alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sheridan County through 645 PM MDT... At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of White Clay to 7 miles west of Gordon to 8 miles east of Rushville. Movement was west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Lone Butte, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road and Pine Ridge. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 90 and 105. Highway 250 between mile markers 40 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
